  "key_formulas": [
    {
      "name": "Reynolds Number",
      "formula": "Re = ρvL/μ",
      "description": "Ratio of inertial forces to viscous forces in a flow",
      "usage_context": "Determining flow regime (laminar vs. turbulent)",
      "variables": {
        "ρ": "fluid density",
        "v": "characteristic velocity",
        "L": "characteristic length",
        "μ": "dynamic viscosity"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Prandtl Number",
      "formula": "Pr = ν/α",
      "description": "Ratio of momentum diffusivity to thermal diffusivity",
      "usage_context": "Comparing relative thicknesses of velocity and thermal boundary layers",
      "variables": {
        "ν": "kinematic viscosity",
        "α": "thermal diffusivity"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Nusselt Number",
      "formula": "Nu = hL/k",
      "description": "Dimensionless heat transfer coefficient",
      "usage_context": "Relating convection to conduction heat transfer",
      "variables": {
        "h": "convection coefficient",
        "L": "characteristic length",
        "k": "thermal conductivity"
      }
    },
    {
      "name": "Sherwood Number",
      "formula": "Sh = hmL/D",
      "description": "Dimensionless mass transfer coefficient",
      "usage_context": "Relating convection to diffusion mass transfer",
      "variables": {
        "hm": "mass transfer coefficient",
        "L": "characteristic length",
        "D": "mass diffusivity"
      }
    }
  ],
  "resources": [

    },

      "title": "Turbulent flow case studies",

    }

structured_output.overall_goal: Master the fundamental concepts of convection heat and mass transfer, focusing on boundary layer fundamentals, convection coefficients, dimensionless parameters, and analogies.

core_concepts.name: Boundary Layer Fundamentals
core_concepts.explanation: Understanding the development of velocity, thermal, and concentration boundary layers, including their significance in convection processes.
core_concepts.importance: Fundamental to analyzing convection processes and heat/mass transfer.
examples: Sketching boundary layer development for different fluids

core_concepts.name: Convection Coefficients
core_concepts.explanation: Local vs. average convection coefficients and their role in heat and mass transfer rate equations.
core_concepts.importance: Essential for determining heat and mass transfer rates in practical applications.
examples: Solving problems involving local vs. average coefficients

core_concepts.explanation: Key dimensionless numbers (Reynolds, Prandtl, Schmidt, Nusselt, Sherwood) and their roles in heat and mass transfer.
core_concepts.importance: Essential for scaling and comparing different systems and flow regimes.
examples: Applying similarity parameters to solve problems

core_concepts.name: Boundary Layer Analogies
core_concepts.explanation: Relationships between heat and mass transfer processes, including Reynolds analogy and evaporative cooling applications.
core_concepts.importance: Allows simplification of complex problems by relating different transfer processes.
